meanings.definition: A person who copies the behavior or actions of another.
meanings.sent1: The imitators in the school play all wore the same costume.
meanings.sent2: The artist's success led to many imitators trying to replicate his style.
meanings.sent3: The imitators at the party had everyone laughing with their spot-on impressions.
meanings.sent4: The imitators of famous singers often struggle to find their own unique voice.
meanings.sent5: The imitators in the mirror mimicked every move she made.

meanings.definition: Something that imitates or copies something else.
meanings.sent1: The toy car was a cheap imitator of the real sports car.
meanings.sent2: The market was flooded with cheap imitators of the popular gadget.
meanings.sent3: The imitator of the famous painting was surprisingly well-done.
meanings.sent4: The imitator of the brand-name shoes looked almost identical.
meanings.sent5: The imitator of the rare flower fooled many with its realistic appearance.
